intro: Dyschoriste trichocalyx subsp. trichocalyx, commonly known as the hairy dyschoriste, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have five petals. The subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations and its potential medicinal properties.
